public ref class PageLinkGeneratorExtensions abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Extension methods for using to generate links to Razor Pages.

MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Routing.PageLinkGeneratorExtensions.GetPathByPage (generator, page, handler, values, pathBase, fragment, options)

Docs.param: The .
The page name. Used to resolve endpoints.
The page handler name. Used to resolve endpoints. Optional.
The route values. Optional. Used to resolve endpoints and expand parameters in the route template.
An optional URI path base. Prepended to the path in the resulting URI.
A URI fragment. Optional. Appended to the resulting URI.
An optional . Settings on provided object override the settings with matching names from RouteOptions.
Docs.summary: Generates a URI with an absolute path based on the provided values.
Docs.returns: A URI with an absolute path, or null if a URI cannot be created.

Docs.param: The .
The associated with the current request.
The page name. Used to resolve endpoints. Optional. If null is provided, the current page route value will be used.
The page handler name. Used to resolve endpoints. Optional.
The route values. Optional. Used to resolve endpoints and expand parameters in the route template.
An optional URI path base. Prepended to the path in the resulting URI. If not provided, the value of will be used.
A URI fragment. Optional. Appended to the resulting URI.
An optional . Settings on provided object override the settings with matching names from RouteOptions.
Docs.summary: Generates a URI with an absolute path based on the provided values.
Docs.returns: A URI with an absolute path, or null if a URI cannot be created.

MemberSignature.Usage: Microsoft.AspNetCore.Routing.PageLinkGeneratorExtensions.GetUriByPage (generator, page, handler, values, scheme, host, pathBase, fragment, options)

Docs.param: The .
The page name. Used to resolve endpoints.
The page handler name. May be null.
The route values. May be null. Used to resolve endpoints and expand parameters in the route template.
The URI scheme, applied to the resulting URI.
The URI host/authority, applied to the resulting URI.
An optional URI path base. Prepended to the path in the resulting URI.
A URI fragment. Optional. Appended to the resulting URI.
An optional . Settings on provided object override the settings with matching names from RouteOptions.
Docs.summary: Generates an absolute URI based on the provided values.
Docs.returns: A absolute URI, or null if a URI cannot be created.

remarks.para: The value of should be a trusted value. Relying on the value of the current request can allow untrusted input to influence the resulting URI unless the Host header has been validated. See the deployment documentation for instructions on how to properly validate the Host header in your deployment environment.
